content:
• Thursday, April 4, 2013
  • HBI

    Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI) reafirms its FY13 view and says it expects to report Q1 net sales of...

    Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI) reafirms its FY13 view and says it expects to report Q1 net sales of approximately $945M; operating profit of $82M to $85M; and EPS of $0.48 to $0.51. The Street is expecting Q1 sales of $974.2M and an EPS of $0.34. Shares +1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (NYSE:VLO) +1.6% AH after its board approves the spinoff of its retail business,...

    Valero Energy (NYSE:VLO) +1.6% AH after its board approves the spinoff of its retail business, CST Brands. VLO said last summer it would explore options for the gasoline and convenience stores it owns in the U.S. and Canada, including a spinoff that gives its shareholders ownership of the retail unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM | 8 Comments
  • WDFC

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ2 comes in mixed, beating on its EPS but coming up short on...

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ2 comes in mixed, beating on its EPS but coming up short on revenue. Net profit fell 1.2% on weaker Americas sales and higher expenses. The company ups its FY13 earnings guidance slightly, now seeing $2.32 to $2.42 per share, above its previous estimate of $2.31 to $2.40, and backed its full-year sales outlook. Americas segment sales, which represent about half of its revenue, shrank 13%, to $40.2M. Sales in Europe rose 16%, to $67.6M, and Asia-Pacific sales were up 18%, at $14.1M. Shares +5.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • XCO

    Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO) +2.1% AH after billionaire investor Wilbur Ross tells a CNBC audience...

    Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO) +2.1% AH after billionaire investor Wilbur Ross tells a CNBC audience his firm has been a big investor in the stock. Ross was discussing opportunities in shale gas explorers, where he says "there's a real disconnect between the physical price of the material and the price of the securities."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 7 Comments
  • WDFC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: WDFC +6%. MAKO +5%. CAJ +3%. SNTS +3%. OIBRC +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: WDFC +6%. MAKO +5%. CAJ +3%. SNTS +3%. OIBRC +2%.
    After-hours top losers: NGD -7%. HMY -6%. CDE -6%. JNPR -5%. IAG -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) -3.8% AH after announcing a public offering of 12M common units....

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) -3.8% AH after announcing a public offering of 12M common units. ETP says it will use net proceeds to pay down debt and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 7 Comments
  • FFIV

    F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) resumes trading and is currently at $75.85, down 16.1% AH in response to its...

    F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) resumes trading and is currently at $75.85, down 16.1% AH in response to its FQ2 warning, which (in the wake of Oracle's results) is bound to heighten concerns about U.S./European enterprise IT demand. Rivals and peers are off in sympathy: CSCO -2.3%. RVBD -3.7% CTXS -3.7%. JNPR -5.1%. VMW -2.2%. EMC -0.9%. RHT -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) warns it expects to report FQ2 (March quarter) revenue of $350.2M and EPS of...

    F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) warns it expects to report FQ2 (March quarter) revenue of $350.2M and EPS of $1.06-$1.07, below a consensus of $375.8M and $1.23. The company blames "a slowdown in North American and to a lesser extent EMEA sales." Telco bookings fell sharply both Q/Q and Y/Y, and U.S. federal bookings were "down significantly" Y/Y. Shares are halted. F5 had received a lot of favorable sell-side commentary in recent weeks. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEHR

    Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ:AEHR) say it's received notification from NASDAQ that it's regained...

    Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ:AEHR) say it's received notification from NASDAQ that it's regained compliance with the $1 minimum closing bid price requirement for continued listing on the NASDAQ Capital Market. -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ1 EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $195.6M beats by $18.29M....

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ1 EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $195.6M beats by $18.29M. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • SYN

    Synthetic Biologics (SYN +4.3%), which was trading lower on the session, jumps after saying a...

    Synthetic Biologics (SYN +4.3%), which was trading lower on the session, jumps after saying a patent issued to the University of California "includes claims to the use of [the company's] drug candidate Trimesta in combination" with Copaxone, Teva's (TEVA -0.8%) annual $14B selling multiple sclerosis drug. 

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNE

    Genie Energy (GNE -12%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at R.F. Lafferty, which notes shares...

    Genie Energy (GNE -12%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at R.F. Lafferty, which notes shares have moved 20% above its $10 target price. GNE's oil shale assets are as yet commercially unproven and many years away from turning into cash flow generating assets, if ever, the firm says; it thinks positive sentiment embracing Israel-related energy stocks has driven GNE too far too soon.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 4 Comments
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +12.5%) ramps higher after saying sales rose 18% Y/Y in March, inline...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +12.5%) ramps higher after saying sales rose 18% Y/Y in March, inline with guidance. Analysts at Baird said organic growth rebounded in March from two consecutive months in the red. LQDT issued downbeat guidance in January precipitating a painful sell-off.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • ADUS

    Addus Homecare (ADUS -1.8%) claws its way back from an earlier -9% hit at the open after...

    Addus Homecare (ADUS -1.8%) claws its way back from an earlier -9% hit at the open after Oppenheimer cut the shares to Perform on valuation with a (somewhat irrelevant since it's trading there now) price target of $13. The stock actually began its selloff yesterday, after hitting a new 52-week high but failing to follow through.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • STL

    Both Sterling Bancorp (STL +13.5%) and Provident New York Bancorp (PBNY +3.2%) are higher on the...

    Both Sterling Bancorp (STL +13.5%) and Provident New York Bancorp (PBNY +3.2%) are higher on the session after the latter agrees to acquire the former in an all stock merger worth $344M. Sterling shareholders will get 1.2625 shares of Provident stock in the deal which will be accretive to Provident's 2014 EPS, will generate $34M in cost savings, and will close in Q4. 

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • FURX

    Furiex Pharmaceuticals (FURX -1%) slips today, in spite of its earlier announcement of a $5M...

    Furiex Pharmaceuticals (FURX -1%) slips today, in spite of its earlier announcement of a $5M milestone payment from the Menarini Group for the launch of Priligy in France. The drug is currently marketed by FURX  in 16 countries in Europe, Asia and Latin America, and is approved in 56 countries worldwide.  Under the it's agreement with Menarini, FURX is eligible to receive up to $40M in sales-based milestones, plus tiered royalties ranging from the mid-teens to mid-twenties in percentage terms.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • XXIA

    Ixia (XXIA -10.1%) sinks after saying it has found an "additional error" in its revenue...

    Ixia (XXIA -10.1%) sinks after saying it has found an "additional error" in its revenue recognition practices and will now restate several previous financial statements including those for FY11 and FY10 as well as those for multiple fiscal quarters. This was not the outcome investors were looking for after the company said last month it would delay its 10K filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • XIDEQ

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -49%) resumes trading after a brief halt and plunges; the move is...

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -49%) resumes trading after a brief halt and plunges; the move is attributed to news suggesting the company has hired Lazard and Akin after traditional refinancing efforts stalled. Also, a Los Angeles Times story out last night discussed potential arsenic concerns at its L.A.-area battery recycling factory.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 6 Comments
  • CMCO

    Magnetek (MAG +8%) rises after saying it received an unsolicited offer from a consortium of...

    Magnetek (MAG +8%) rises after saying it received an unsolicited offer from a consortium of investors to acquire the company for "a price in the range of $15." The company turned down the offer after management concluded the proposal was not in the company's best interest given its "strategic plans [and] long-term prospects."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +1.8%) says it's amended its multi-target agreement with Novartis (NVS -0.6%),...

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +1.8%) says it's amended its multi-target agreement with Novartis (NVS -0.6%), which was originally entered into in October, 2010. As a result, IMGN is eligible to receive a $1M upfront fee and the opportunity to receive milestone payments potentially totaling approximately $200M or $238M, depending on the composition of any resultant products.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • HUN

    Huntsman (HUN +3.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $25 target price at Monness Crespi,...

    Huntsman (HUN +3.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $25 target price at Monness Crespi, which cites restructuring efforts in place and additional overall capacity as boosting operating leverage. Amongst the major, economically oriented chemical producers, HUN is currently trading at one of the least expensive valuations, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy (PDCE -6.9%) shares plunge as the company updates guidance at its Analyst Day; PDCE...

    PDC Energy (PDCE -6.9%) shares plunge as the company updates guidance at its Analyst Day; PDCE sees FY 2013 EPS of $0.91-$1.20 vs. $0.95 analyst consensus and revenues of $339M-$385M vs. $417M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • PT-OLD

    Goldman upgrades Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD +4.8%) to Conviction Buy from Neutral, stoking a rally...

    Goldman upgrades Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD +4.8%) to Conviction Buy from Neutral, stoking a rally in shares of the European/Latin American carrier. After rallying to start the year, PT shares had slumped over the last 2 months thanks to European macro concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • LQMT

    Liquidmetal Technologies (OTCQB:LQMT +13.4%) spikes midday after saying it delivered five new...

    Liquidmetal Technologies (OTCQB:LQMT +13.4%) spikes midday after saying it delivered five new prototypes to five different customers in Q1, representing a 67% Y/Y increase. The company also says more of its active prototypes are being evaluated by customers and notes it is making inroads in the oil and gas industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • TDC

    Morgan Stanley removes Teradata (TDC -8.5%) from its Best Ideas list, and is cutting its 2013...

    Morgan Stanley removes Teradata (TDC -8.5%) from its Best Ideas list, and is cutting its 2013 estimates. Analyst Katy Huberty cites an April CIO survey indicating weakening industry growth, and weak results from peers Oracle and Tibco. She does, however, expect the data warehousing/analytics solutions vendor to "achieve 10% annual revenue growth over the mid- to long-term." Shares are making fresh 52-week lows; they fell in February after CFO Stephen Scheppmann suggested U.S. customers weren't committing to large deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • CROX

    Crocs (CROX +3%) trades higher after the retailer names a new Chief Marketing Officer and gets...

    Crocs (CROX +3%) trades higher after the retailer names a new Chief Marketing Officer and gets mentioned by Leon Cooperman as a good stock for investors to be long.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • VLO

    Refiners recoup a sliver of losses from their two-day slide following concerns about looming...

    Refiners recoup a sliver of losses from their two-day slide following concerns about looming expenses from newly announced emissions regulations. Barclays believes refiners are fundamentally cheap for long-term investors, the EPA's new rules are "not as bad as it seems" and the Brent/WTI spread should widen. VLO +1.1%, TSO +0.6%, WNR +3.9%, MPC +1.5%, ALJ +3.1%, HFC +1.3%, CVI +1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +2%) moves up today on slightly heavier-than-usual volumes, possibly...

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +2%) moves up today on slightly heavier-than-usual volumes, possibly getting a boost from North Korea's ramped up nuclear threats and the fact that the company is working on a medical radiation countermeasure, Entolimod. The company also announced late Tuesday that it had received a Notice of Allowance from the FDA for an investigational new drug application for CBL0137.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY +12.4%) have put together a double-digit rally after its plan to set up...

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY +12.4%) have put together a double-digit rally after its plan to set up Samsung mini stores in outlets is well-received. Analysts think it might be just be the tip of the iceberg with the company aiming to let other retailers set up boutiques inside of its stores as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • GBX

    Greenbrier (GBX -5.64%) slips today on a mixed FQ2 report, beating on a per share basis but...

    Greenbrier (GBX -5.64%) slips today on a mixed FQ2 report, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Net earnings fell 22% Y/Y for the railroad equipment and services provider, as new railcar deliveries continued to decline. Sales in the company's manufacturing segment dropped 8% to $294M, while its wheel services, refurbishment & parts segment declined over 6% to $112M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • TI

    Telecom Italia's (TI +8%) board will evaluate options for the carrier's mobile phone ops next...

    Telecom Italia's (TI +8%) board will evaluate options for the carrier's mobile phone ops next week, including M&A deals, two sources tell Bloomberg. A tie-up with Hutchinson Whampoa's Italian unit is named as a possibility - such a deal could diminish competitive pressures. Like many other European carriers, TI's mobile unit has been pressured by macro issues and declining voice/text revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR -13.1%) provides an operational update on its Venezuelan...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR -13.1%) provides an operational update on its Venezuelan affiliate Petrodelta: Total proved plus probable reserves at year-end 2012, net to Harvest's 32% share of Petrodelta, were 100M boe, 3% lower than year-end 2011. Confirms it will restate financial results for some periods in 2011-12; adjustments are considered material.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • SOL

    A deal with South African solar manufacturer Solairedirect is helping ReneSola (SOL +3.2%) tick...

    A deal with South African solar manufacturer Solairedirect is helping ReneSola (SOL +3.2%) tick higher.  Solairedirect's manufacturing subsidiary has agreed to make 120MW worth of ReneSola-branded solar modules over 3 years, with its parent company having committed to to buying 54MW of them for solar projects. ReneSola adds Solairedirect could make additional modules if it chooses to expand its production capacity. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • AIN

    Albany International (AIN +3.5%) gains today after Stifel Nicolaus initiates coverage with a Buy...

    Albany International (AIN +3.5%) gains today after Stifel Nicolaus initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a $38 price target. Stifel sees the "best of times" for it's engineered composites segment, due to its sole source supplier position for the composite cold-section fan blades and fan case for the LEAP family of jet engines, which power the workhorses of the global commercial airplane fleet. Additionally, the company has a strong cash flow generator in its mature paper product supply business, which will drive strong operating margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM

  • It's a true "regime change" at the BOJ, says Citigroup, commenting on the central bank's new...

    It's a true "regime change" at the BOJ, says Citigroup, commenting on the central bank's new easing measures overnight. Gone is any hint of concern about monetizing government paper, and up next may be additional stimulus in the form of equity purchases and loans to small and medium-sized enterprises. The yen (FXY -3.6%) continues a whopper of a move lower, the dollar now at a session-high ¥96.38. The currency-hedged Japan stock ETF (DXJ) gains 7.5% vs. the unhedged EWJ +3.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 4 Comments
  • NVIV

    InVivo Therapeutics (NVIV +19.9%) rises sharply on heavy volume after announcing the FDA has...

    InVivo Therapeutics (NVIV +19.9%) rises sharply on heavy volume after announcing the FDA has approved its request for a Humanitarian Use Device designation for its biopolymer scaffolding product. The designation should help the company speed the product to market. A clinical trial submission is being reviewed by the FDA currently. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTL

    CenturyLink's (CTL +2.4%) dividend (current yield of 6%) is sustainable, declares JPMorgan's...

    CenturyLink's (CTL +2.4%) dividend (current yield of 6%) is sustainable, declares JPMorgan's Philip Cusick while upgrading shares to Buy - CenturyLink crashed in Feb. after cutting its dividend by over 25%. Cusick notes the telco's yield remains higher than Verizon and AT&T's, and believes it has been making good use of its $2B buyback plan. The upgrade comes as rural telcos try to take advantage of FCC chairman Julius Genachowski's pending departure to get Congress to implement a "time out" for the FCC's Universal Service Fund reforms.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • CLRX

    Shares of CollabRx (CLRX +33%) soar this morning after announcing it's formed a partnership in...

    Shares of CollabRx (CLRX +33%) soar this morning after announcing it's formed a partnership in molecular diagnostics with Belgian company OncoDNA to purchase CollabRx SaaS-based technology and content resources to be used in conjunction with OncoDNA's cancer mutation panels. Together, they will develop a combined test and medical informatics solution by pairing results of cancer mutational panels developed by OncoDNA with clinically actionable and dynamically updated information provided by CollabRx.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • MVIS

    Microvision (MVIS -7.5%) falls in volatile (and heavy) early trading after posting outsized...

    Microvision (MVIS -7.5%) falls in volatile (and heavy) early trading after posting outsized gains Wednesday. Earlier, SA contributor Paulo Santos mentioned the stock in an article ominously titled "Caveat Emptor Beckons". 
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • FNSR

    Finisar (FNSR +7.2%) soars on an upgrade to Buy from Lazard. The firm is setting a $17 PT, and...

    Finisar (FNSR +7.2%) soars on an upgrade to Buy from Lazard. The firm is setting a $17 PT, and declares the optical component vendor's risk/reward attractive at current levels. Shares have had a rough year, thanks in part to silicon photonics concerns and an underwhelming FQ3 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • OLED

    Needham upgrades Universal Display (PANL +5.4%) to Buy, citing "growing confidence" in ramping...

    Needham upgrades Universal Display (PANL +5.4%) to Buy, citing "growing confidence" in ramping materials sales to Samsung and a valuation of 18.5x 2014E EPS (exc. net cash). Cowen recently declared strong Galaxy S IV pre-order activity in the U.K. a positive for PANL. Shares have mostly been range-bound for the last 2 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -1.5%) slides on a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. The enterprise Wi-Fi...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -1.5%) slides on a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. The enterprise Wi-Fi hardware maker remains a favorite of shorts, with 21.7% of the float shorted as of March 15. Shares jumped in February following strong FQ2 results and FQ3 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • DTEGY

    Sources say Deutsche Telekom unit T-Mobile USA (OTCQX:DTEGY) is considering changing the terms...

    Sources say Deutsche Telekom unit T-Mobile USA (OTCQX:DTEGY) is considering changing the terms of its proposed merger with Metro PCS (PCS +2.1%) ahead of a shareholder vote next week. There has been broad speculation T-Mobile would sweeten the pot.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are holding onto gains after worse-than-expected weekly...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are holding onto gains after worse-than-expected weekly jobless claims brought them down a peg or two, with the S&P Mini +0.2%. Japan's declaration of all out war on deflation had played a part in boosting stocks across the globe, including in Europe, although comments from Mario Draghi have helped drag shares in the region solidly lower. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, Fed's George
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • CBMX

    CombiMatrix (NASDAQ:CBMX) +19.6% premarket after reporting billable prenatal testing volumes...

    CombiMatrix (NASDAQ:CBMX) +19.6% premarket after reporting billable prenatal testing volumes rose 127% in Q1 from a year earlier, and the genetic-based testing company says it plans to expand its offerings to capture share in the rapidly growing market. Overall billable testing volumes rose 25% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • EYPT

    pSivida (PSDV) +12.8% premarket after saying it signed a funded technology evaluation agreement...

    pSivida (PSDV) +12.8% premarket after saying it signed a funded technology evaluation agreement with a leading global pharmaceutical company, which will evaluate PSDV's proprietary Durasert and Tethadur technologies for the unnamed company's select products in ophthalmology.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • CBMX

    Premarket gainers: CBMX +20%. PSDV +13%. NAVB +10%. ALU +9%. ARIA +6%.

    Premarket gainers: CBMX +20%. PSDV +13%. NAVB +10%. ALU +9%. ARIA +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • ALLT

    Allot Communications (NASDAQ:ALLT) secures $6.5M licensing expansion order to expand the...

    Allot Communications (NASDAQ:ALLT) secures $6.5M licensing expansion order to expand the functionality of previously-deployed Allot Service Gateways. CEO Rami Hadar says the deal "further validates the importance of the [company's technology] in helping operators better capitalize on network traffic." Shares +4.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • CRY

    CryoLife (NYSE:CRY) looks set to open higher after announcing it has received FDA approval for a...

    CryoLife (NYSE:CRY) looks set to open higher after announcing it has received FDA approval for a new long-term vascular access device (HeRO) which the company will launch in Q4 after validating its manufacturing processes. Shares +4.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) looks to retrace yesterday's losses after Wedbush says a WSJ article...

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) looks to retrace yesterday's losses after Wedbush says a WSJ article about proposed regulation of prenatal screening tests likely overstates the case as the FDA "has missed its window to regulate the non-invasive prenatal testing market." Analyst Zarak Khurshid upgrades the stock to Outperform from Neutral and reiterates a price target of $5. Shares +3.4% premarket. 

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • CCL

    Shares of Carnival Cruise (NYSE:CCL) slip 2% in premarket trading after cruise ship Triumph...

    Shares of Carnival Cruise (NYSE:CCL) slip 2% in premarket trading after cruise ship Triumph breaks away from its mooring at the Alabama shipyard where it was being repaired. By all appearance, the incident was caused by strong winds and nothing the company did wrong although it brings more attention to the company's string of mishaps.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +7.8%) after saying that its Lymphoseek radiopharmaceutical met...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +7.8%) after saying that its Lymphoseek radiopharmaceutical met its primary endpoint in a Phase III trial by identifying sentinel lymph nodes in patients with squamous cell carcinoma (skin cancer) of the head or in the mouth, Until now, expensive surgery has been used. Following the results, the study's Data Safety Monitoring Committee has recommended that Navidea close the trial early. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) gets a welcome upgrade from Deutsche Bank to Buy from Hold. DB says cost...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) gets a welcome upgrade from Deutsche Bank to Buy from Hold. DB says cost cuts, corporate changes, and "positive revenue and margin inflection" make for a compelling turnaround story. The bank also says capex growth in the U.S. and China should mean improvement in the networks revenue environment. Shares +11% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 2 Comments

  • Haruhiko Kuroda's blitzkrieg on deflation helps Asian stocks in general to pare losses and...

    Haruhiko Kuroda's blitzkrieg on deflation helps Asian stocks in general to pare losses and Japanese stocks in particular to finish sharply higher. However, South Korean equities feel the impact of the increasing bellicosity emanating from North Korea. Japan +2.2%, Hong Kong closed, China closed, India -0.7%, South Korea -1.2%, the biggest drop in four months.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 AM | 1 Comment

  • The Nikkei (NKY) surges and the yen (FXY) plummets after the Bank of Japan starts firing the...

    The Nikkei (NKY) surges and the yen (FXY) plummets after the Bank of Japan starts firing the heavy artillery in its battle against deflation. Under new Governor Haruhiko Kuroda, the BOJ is changing its target when setting policy from the overnight call rate to the monetary base, which the bank aims to double within two years by purchasing ¥60-70T of assets a year, including government bonds of all maturities and not just short-term debt. The plan is open-ended and was unanimously approved. The Nikkei is +1.3% after being lower earlier, while the dollar is +1.5% vs the yen. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 AM | 14 Comments
